Module count
Package count.ds

Class AnnotatedTable

java.lang.Object
count.ds.AnnotatedTable
All Implemented Interfaces:
ProfileTable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AnnotatedTable.DerivedTable, SimulatedEvolution.Table
public class AnnotatedTable
extends Object
implements ProfileTable
Stores a table of family sizes across a number of organisms. A table is always linked to a list of terminal taxon names. This list may be initialized at instantiation. Families may have associated properties beyond then copy numbers and the family name.
Since:
April 17, 2008, 3:23 PM
Author:
Miklós Csűrös csurosm@gmail.com

    • getNumFamiliesPresent

      public int getNumFamiliesPresent​(int taxon_idx)
      Returns the number of families present at a terminal taxon
      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • setTable

      public void setTable​(int[][] table, String[] family_names)
      Sets the table from externally constructed data.
      Parameters:
      table - family sizes: table[i][j] is the size of the i-th family in the j-th species (this latter indexed as in terminal_taxa)
      family_names - names for the families in the order of the indexes into the int[] array; if null, then they are set to are set to "F1,F2,..."

    • mapTo

      public void mapTo​(IndexedTree tree)

      private void checkMissingEntries()

    • getPatternString

      public static String getPatternString​(int[] profile)
      String representation of the pattern: numbers with at least two digits are enclosed in parentheses, one-digit numbers are simply listed. Example: 017(12)4
      Parameters:
      profile - array of sizes
      Returns:
      a String representation of the extended phyletic pattern
